title: Defensive item
data:
When a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") is generated, there is a chance that it will be given a **defensive item** to protect itself from hostile [adventurers](/wiki/You "You"). This will happen if the monster's level equals or exceeds the roll of a *d50*.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) The following monster types are ineligible for defensive items:

- [Animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal")
- Monsters with [explosion attacks](/wiki/Explosion_attack "Explosion attack")
- [Mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless") monsters
- [Ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") and [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade")
- [Keystone Kops](/wiki/Keystone_Kop_\(monster_class\) "Keystone Kop (monster class)") of any rank

In addition, regular [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") have a 12/13 chance of missing out on the defensive item roll.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

If chosen to receive a defensive item, the monster selects and rolls a die according to its difficulty:

| Difficulty | Roll  |
| ---------- | ----- |
| 3 or less  | *d8*  |
| 4–6        | *d9*  |
| 7–8        | *d10* |
| 9 or more  | *d11* |

The die roll determines the item, as shown by the following table:[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

| Roll | Outcome                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| ---- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1–2  | [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation")                                                                                                                                         |
| 3    | [scroll of create monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_create_monster "Scroll of create monster")                                                                                                                                      |
| 4    | [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing")                                                                                                                                                           |
| 5    | [potion of extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing")                                                                                                                                         |
| 6    | [potion of full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing") ([potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness") for [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence"))                      |
| 7    | [wand of teleportation](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") (33%) or [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") (67%) (reroll up to 2 times if no-teleport level) |
| 8    | [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging") (nothing for [floating eyes](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye"))[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)                                                                           |
|      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| 9    | [wand of create monster](/wiki/Wand_of_create_monster "Wand of create monster") (33%) or [scroll of create monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_create_monster "Scroll of create monster") (67%)                                       |
|      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| 10   | (teleport item, same as case 7)                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| 11   | (create-monster item, same as case 9)                                                                                                                                                                                      |

## Use

Non-[animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal"), non-[mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless") monsters will use defensive items when they are within 5 squares Euclidean distance of [you](/wiki/You "You") and they have a problem that needs fixing:[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

- Non-cursed unicorn horn is used by a monster with hands when [confused](/wiki/Confuse "Confuse"), [stunned](/wiki/Stun "Stun"), or [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind")[\[10\]](#cite_note-10).

- [Lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") corpse or tin is eaten when [confused](/wiki/Confuse "Confuse") or [stunned](/wiki/Stun "Stun").

- A healing item (potion of full healing, extra healing, or healing, in that order[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)) is used by a monster with hands that has been blinded.[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

- Monsters will only do the following if their HP is less than 1⁄5 of their maximum when your experience level is less than 10, 1⁄4 HP when XL is between 10 and 13, or 1⁄3 when your XL is at least 14:[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)

  - Peaceful monsters will quaff a healing potion if they have hands, but not attempt to use any other defensive items.

  - Non-peaceful monsters that are not stuck or immobile will attempt to flee through [stairs](/wiki/Stair "Stair") or [traps](/wiki/Trap "Trap") (teleporters and holes).

  - Mercenaries will use a [bugle](/wiki/Bugle "Bugle") if there are more mercenaries within 3 squares that can be woken up.[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)

  - The following items will be used by a monster with hands:[\[15\]](#cite_note-15)

    - [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging"), except by shopkeepers, guards, or priests; in Sokoban; or where digging is ineffective.
    - [wand](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") or [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation"), unless the monster knows that the level is no-teleport.
      - shopkeepers in their shop, guards, and priests will not use cursed scrolls of teleportation.
    - potions of [full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing"), [extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing"), or [healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing"); [wand](/wiki/Wand_of_create_monster "Wand of create monster") or [scroll of create monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_create_monster "Scroll of create monster").

## See Also

- [Monster starting inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory")
- [Miscellaneous item](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item")
- [Offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item")
- [Death drop](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop")

Defensive item

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

When a monster is generated, there is a chance that it will be given a defensive item to protect itself from hostile adventurers. This will happen if the monster's level equals or exceeds the roll of a d50.[1] The following monster types are ineligible for defensive items:

  • Animals
  • Monsters with explosion attacks
  • Mindless monsters
  • Ghosts and shades
  • Keystone Kops of any rank

In addition, regular soldiers have a 12/13 chance of missing out on the defensive item roll.[2]

If chosen to receive a defensive item, the monster selects and rolls a die according to its difficulty:

Difficulty Roll
3 or less d8
4–6 d9
7–8 d10
9 or more d11

The die roll determines the item, as shown by the following table:[3]

Roll Outcome
1–2 scroll of teleportation
3 scroll of create monster
4 potion of healing
5 potion of extra healing
6 potion of full healing
(potion of sickness for Pestilence)
7 wand of teleportation (33%) or scroll of teleportation (67%)
(reroll up to 2 times if no-teleport level)
8 wand of digging
(nothing for floating eyes)[8]
9 wand of create monster (33%) or scroll of create monster (67%)
10 (teleport item, same as case 7)
11 (create-monster item, same as case 9)

Use

Non-animal, non-mindless monsters will use defensive items when they are within 5 squares Euclidean distance of you and they have a problem that needs fixing:[9]

  • Non-cursed unicorn horn is used by a monster with hands when confused, stunned, or blind[10].
  • Lizard corpse or tin is eaten when confused or stunned.
  • A healing item (potion of full healing, extra healing, or healing, in that order[11]) is used by a monster with hands that has been blinded.[12]
  • Monsters will only do the following if their HP is less than 1⁄5 of their maximum when your experience level is less than 10, 1⁄4 HP when XL is between 10 and 13, or 1⁄3 when your XL is at least 14:[13]
    • Peaceful monsters will quaff a healing potion if they have hands, but not attempt to use any other defensive items.
    • Non-peaceful monsters that are not stuck or immobile will attempt to flee through stairs or traps (teleporters and holes).
    • Mercenaries will use a bugle if there are more mercenaries within 3 squares that can be woken up.[14]
    • The following items will be used by a monster with hands:[15]
      • wand of digging, except by shopkeepers, guards, or priests; in Sokoban; or where digging is ineffective.
      • wand or scroll of teleportation, unless the monster knows that the level is no-teleport.
        • shopkeepers in their shop, guards, and priests will not use cursed scrolls of teleportation.
      • potions of full healing, extra healing, or healing; wand or scroll of create monster.
